response:
## Summary

Across the documents, owners/customers generally pay the commercial charges, fees, and taxes, while certain costs are split in arbitration, and legal fees may be shifted after non‑payment. John Doe/Fabrikam Construction must pay Contoso Lifts LLC the full invoice amount of **$29,900.00** (no tax listed) as an initial payment per contract, with checks payable to Contoso Lifts LLC or via its online portal.[1][2] In the related lift contract, the customer must pay the **$29,900.00** contract price in three installments: **$20,000.00 upon signing**, **$7,000.00 upon delivery**, and **$2,900.00 upon completion**, and may be liable for the contractor’s legal fees if they fail to pay.[6][14] In the property management agreement, the Owner must pay the Agent a non‑refundable **$250.00** start‑up fee at execution, a **25%** commission on gross revenues for short‑term rentals and **10%** for long‑term leases, a **$75.00/month** advertising charge for short‑term rentals, a **$50.00/month** minimum administration/accounting charge, a **10%** fee on the total charge for repairs/upgrades/renovations, **$35/hour** for scheduling/escorting contractors, and Hawaii Gross Excise tax of **4.712%** on all these fees, commissions, and charges; the Agent may also deduct credit card/bankcard fees from the Owner’s proceeds.[4][5][9][10][11][12][13][16][17] In arbitration, each party must pay one‑half of the arbitration costs and fees and their own respective costs, including attorneys’ fees.[3] For holding tank servicing, the owner must pay the pumper for charges incurred as mutually agreed.[8]

## Key Points

- John Doe/Fabrikam Construction is invoiced **$29,900.00** by Contoso Lifts LLC (subtotal, total, and amount due all **$29,900.00**, tax “N/A”), payable to Contoso Lifts LLC or via its online portal; payment is due on contract signing as an initial payment.[1][2]
- The lift contract sets a total contract price of **$29,900.00**, payable by the customer in three installments: **$20,000.00 upon signing**, **$7,000.00 upon delivery**, and **$2,900.00 upon completion**.[6]
- Failure to pay under the lift contract may result in legal action, and legal fees are recoverable by the Contractor from the non‑paying party.[14]
- In arbitration, each party must pay one‑half (**1/2**) of the cost and fees of the arbitration and their own respective costs, including attorneys’ fees.[3]
- In the property management agreement, the Owner must pay:
  - A non‑refundable start‑up fee of **$250.00** upon execution of the agreement.[4][13]
  - A **25%** fee/commission on gross revenues for short‑term/vacation rentals (less than 180 days).[9][11][12]
  - A **10%** fee/commission on gross revenues for long‑term leases (more than 180 days).[11][12][17]
  - A pro‑ration advertising charge of **$75.00/month** for short‑term rentals.[10][11][17]
  - A minimum administration and accounting charge of **$50.00/month** (excluding tax preparation/returns/forms).[10][16][17]
  - A **10%** fee on the total charge for repairs, upgrades, and/or renovations.[10][16]
  - A **$35/hour** charge to schedule repairs/upgrades/renovations and to escort contractors/repair persons/technicians/handymen.[5][16]
  - Hawaii Gross Excise tax of **4.712%** on all the above fees, commissions, and charges.[4][5]
- The Owner authorizes the Agent to accept credit cards and to deduct credit card/bankcard fees from the Owner’s proceeds (i.e., the Owner ultimately bears these fees).[9][12]
- The Agent pays advertising invoices initially but passes the advertising cost on to the Owner via monthly proceeds statements.[7]
- For holding tank servicing, the owner must pay the pumper for charges incurred in servicing the holding tank(s), as mutually agreed between owner and pumper.[8]

The Agent shall use such fee to pay initial administrative expenses of including the premises (property) in its rental program, to conduct a complete inventory of all furniture and furnishings in the rental unit, to produce a condition/inspection report of the premises, appliances and contents, and to pay other sums initially required for the performance of its duties under this agreement. (c) A fee/commission of ten percent (10%) of the gross revenues for management services for long term leases (leases of more than 180 days). [13] Upon the execution of this Agreement, the Owner shall pay two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) to the Agent as a non-refundable start-up fee. The Agent shall use such fee to pay initial administrative expenses of including the premises (property) in its rental program, to conduct a complete inventory of all furniture and furnishings in the rental unit, to produce a condition/inspection report of the premises, appliances and contents, and to pay other sums initially required for the performance of its duties under this agreement. Failure to pay may result in legal action. [14] Failure to pay may result in legal action. Legal fees are recoverable by Contractor. Contractor holds risk until delivery. === DOCUMENT: doc_d83867cd24a9402ab15f58cdfbb36462 === [8] The owner agrees to maintain the all-weather access road or drive so that the pumper can service the holding tank(s) with the pumping equipment. The owner further agrees to pay the pumper for a charges incurred in servicing the holding tank(s) as mutually agreed upon by the owner and pumper. The pumper agrees to submit to the County, reports for the servicing of the holding tank(s) in manner specified by the County.
